Notes.Text:
This update fixes the following security issues:

- The following vulnerabilities allowed Wireshark to be crashed by
  injecting a malformed packet onto the wire or by convincing someone
  to read a malformed packet trace file.
  + The WCCP dissector could crash
    wnpa-sec-2015-01 CVE-2015-0559 CVE-2015-0560 [boo#912365]
  + The LPP dissector could crash.
    wnpa-sec-2015-02 CVE-2015-0561 [boo#912368]
  + The DEC DNA Routing Protocol dissector could crash.
    wnpa-sec-2015-03 CVE-2015-0562 [boo#912369]
  + The SMTP dissector could crash. 
    wnpa-sec-2015-04 CVE-2015-0563 [boo#912370]
  + Wireshark could crash while decypting TLS/SSL sessions.
    wnpa-sec-2015-05 CVE-2015-0564 [boo#912372]
Notes.Title: Details

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12

Vulnerabilities.Description: Multiple use-after-free vulnerabilities in epan/dissectors/packet-wccp.c in the WCCP dissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.12 and 1.12.x before 1.12.3 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet, related to the use of packet-scope memory instead of pinfo-scope memory.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12:wireshark-devel-1.10.12-4.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: The dissect_wccp2r1_address_table_info function in epan/dissectors/packet-wccp.c in the WCCP dissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.12 and 1.12.x before 1.12.3 does not initialize certain data structures, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12:wireshark-devel-1.10.12-4.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: asn1/lpp/lpp.cnf in the LPP dissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.12 and 1.12.x before 1.12.3 does not validate a certain index value, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memory access and application crash) via a crafted packet.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12:wireshark-devel-1.10.12-4.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: Multiple use-after-free vulnerabilities in epan/dissectors/packet-dec-dnart.c in the DEC DNA Routing Protocol dissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.12 and 1.12.x before 1.12.3 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet, related to the use of packet-scope memory instead of pinfo-scope memory.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12:wireshark-devel-1.10.12-4.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: epan/dissectors/packet-smtp.c in the SMTP dissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.12 and 1.12.x before 1.12.3 uses an incorrect length value for certain string-append operations, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:wireshark-1.10.12-4.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12:wireshark-devel-1.10.12-4.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: Buffer underflow in the ssl_decrypt_record function in epan/dissectors/packet-ssl-utils.c in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.12 and 1.12.x before 1.12.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet that is improperly handled during decryption of an SSL session.
